video.title: Machine Learning without the Hype
video.description:
What is artificial intelligence, machine learning, and deep learning mean in general?
When is a rule-based approach the right solution and when do you need machine learning?
What does machine learning mean for time-series data?
What is the difference between supervised and unsupervised learning in this area?
What could an example with an actual dataset look like?

Talk by Philip Krenn at the Voxxed Days Vienna 2018 conference.

Thanks to Devoxx for giving us permission to post this talk. freeCodeCamp is not associated with this talk. We're just excited to bring more exposure to to it!

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.com

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.com

topLevelComment.author: Daporan
topLevelComment.text: I've got some AI/Machine learning videos on my channel. Let me know if there's any you would like to see in detail.

topLevelComment.author: Cesare Borgia
topLevelComment.text: Don't know what the other guy's talking about. I understand him just fine.
I can't understand what he's saying. Sounds like he got a bee sting on the lips. Needs to articulate better.

replies.author: liproqq
replies.text: He's got a thick german accent. Maybe you're not familiar with it.

replies.author: Hugo Santos
replies.text: His speech is actually easy to understand, I don't see what trouble you could be having.

replies.author: Marty
replies.text: I didnt have an issue understanding him....but there is an option to add the closed captions
amazinglazedonut man you took that really personally huh
